Smoother factory¶

This package implements various types of smoothers.

class smoother_factory.Smoother(sz, spacing, params)[source]¶

Abstract base class defining the general smoother interface.

sz = None¶

image size

spacing = None¶

image spacing

fdt = None¶

finite difference support for torch

volumeElement = None¶

volume of pixel/voxel

dim = None¶

dimension

params = None¶

ParameterDict() parameter object holding various configuration options

smooth_scalar_field(I, Iout=None)[source]¶

Abstract method to smooth a scalar field. Only this method should be overwritten in derived classes.

Parameters:
  • I – input image to smooth
  • Iout – if not None then result is returned in this variable
Returns:

should return the a smoothed scalar field, image dimension XxYxZ
inverse_smooth_scalar_field(I, Iout=None)[source]¶

Experimental abstract method (NOT PROPERLY TESTED) to apply “inverse”-smoothing to a scalar field

Parameters:
  • I – input image to inverse smooth
  • Iout – if not None then result is returned in this variable
Returns:

should return the inverse-smoothed scalar field, image dimension XxYxZ
smooth_scalar_field_multiNC(I, Iout=None)[source]¶

Smoothes a scalar field of dimension BxCxXxYxZ (i.e, can smooth a batch and multi-channel images)

Parameters:
  • I – input image to smooth
  • Iout – if not None then result is returned in this variable
Returns:

smoothed image
smooth_scalar_field_multiC(I, Iout=None)[source]¶

Smoothes a scalar field of dimension CxXxYxZ (i.e, can smooth multi-channel images)

Parameters:
  • I – input image to smooth
  • Iout – if not None then result is returned in this variable
Returns:

smoothed image
inverse_smooth_vector_field_multiN(v, vout=None)[source]¶

Inverse-smoothes (EXPERIMENTAL, NOT PROPERLY TESTED) a vector field of dimension NxdimxXxYxZ

Parameters:
  • v – vector field to smooth
  • vout – if not None then result is returned in this variable
Returns:

smoothed vector field
inverse_smooth_vector_field(v, vout=None)[source]¶

Inverse-smoothes (EXPERIMENTAL, NOT PROPERLY TESTED) a vector field of dimension dimxXxYxZ

Parameters:
  • v – vector field to smooth
  • vout – if not None then result is returned in this variable
Returns:

smoothed vector field
smooth_vector_field_multiN(v, vout=None)[source]¶

Smoothes a vector field of dimension NxdimxXxYxZ

Parameters:
  • v – vector field to smooth
  • vout – if not None then result is returned in this variable
Returns:

smoothed vector field
smooth_vector_field(v, vout=None)[source]¶

Smoothes a vector field of dimension dimxXxYxZ

Parameters:
  • v – vector field to smooth
  • vout – if not None then result is returned in this variable
Returns:

smoothed vector field
class smoother_factory.DiffusionSmoother(sz, spacing, params)[source]¶

Smoothing by solving the diffusion equation iteratively.

iter = None¶

number of iterations

set_iter(iter)[source]¶

Set the number of iterations for the diffusion smoother

Parameters:iter – number of iterations
Returns:returns the number of iterations
get_iter()[source]¶

Returns the set number of iterations

Returns:number of iterations

Smoothes a scalar field of dimension XxYxZ

Parameters:
  • v – input image
  • vout – if not None returns the result in this variable
Returns:

smoothed image
inverse_smooth_scalar_field(v, vout=None)[source]¶
class smoother_factory.GaussianSmoother(sz, spacing, params)[source]¶

Gaussian smoothing in the spatial domain (hence, SLOW in high dimensions on the CPU at least).

Todo

Clean up the two implementations (spatial and Fourier of the Gaussian smoothers). In particular, assure that all computions are done in physical coordinates. For now these are just in [-1,1]^d

class smoother_factory.GaussianSpatialSmoother(sz, spacing, params)[source]¶

size of half the smoothing kernel

filter = None¶

smoothing filter

Set the size of half the smoothing kernel

Parameters:k_sz_h – size of half the kernel as array
get_k_sz_h()[source]¶

Returns the size of half the smoothing kernel

Returns:return half the smoothing kernel size
smooth_scalar_field(v, vout=None)[source]¶

Smooth the scalar field using Gaussian smoothing in the spatial domain

Parameters:
  • v – image to smooth
  • vout – if not None returns the result in this variable
Returns:

smoothed image
inverse_smooth_scalar_field(v, vout=None)[source]¶

Not yet implemented

class smoother_factory.GaussianFourierSmoother(sz, spacing, params)[source]¶

Performs Gaussian smoothing via convolution in the Fourier domain. Much faster for large dimensions than spatial Gaussian smoothing on the CPU in large dimensions.

gaussianStd = None¶

stanard deviation of Gaussian

FFilter = None¶

filter in Fourier domain

set_gaussian_std(gstd)[source]¶

Set the standard deviation of the Gaussian filter

Parameters:gstd – standard deviation
get_gaussian_std()[source]¶

Return the standard deviation of the Gaussian filter

Returns:standard deviation of Gaussian filter
smooth_scalar_field(v, vout=None)[source]¶

Smooth the scalar field using Gaussian smoothing in the Fourier domain

Parameters:
  • v – image to smooth
  • vout – if not None returns the result in this variable
Returns:

smoothed image
inverse_smooth_scalar_field(v, vout=None)[source]¶

Inverse-smooth the scalar field using Gaussian smoothing in the Fourier domain (with the inverse of the Fourier transform of the Gaussian; EXPERIMENTAL, requires regularization to avoid divisions by zero. DO NOT USE AT THE MOMENT.)

Parameters:
  • v – image to inverse-smooth
  • vout – if not None returns the result in this variable
Returns:

inverse-smoothed image
class smoother_factory.SmootherFactory(sz, spacing)[source]¶

Factory to quickly create different types of smoothers.

spacing = None¶

spatial spacing of image

sz = None¶

size of image

dim = None¶

dimension of image

default_smoother_type = None¶

default smoother used for smoothing

set_default_smoother_type_to_gaussian()[source]¶

Set the default smoother type to Gaussian smoothing in the Fourier domain

set_default_smoother_type_to_diffusion()[source]¶

Set the default smoother type to diffusion smoothing

set_default_smoother_type_to_gaussianSpatial()[source]¶

Set the default smoother type to Gaussian smoothing in the spatial domain

create_smoother(params)[source]¶

Create the desired smoother :param params: ParamterDict() object to hold paramters which should be passed on :return: returns the smoother
